item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Tuesday, March 4, 2025 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Use Firefox in 2025 (56 points | 39 comments)
2. TigerBeetle Architecture (17 points | 2 comments)
3. Avoid the nightmare bicycle (13 points | 6 comments)
4. VT220 font emulation in browser (20 points | 11 comments)
5. Mozilla updates Firefox's Terms again after backlash (7 points | 6 comments)
6. Do not run any Cargo commands on untrusted projects (17 points | 13 comments)
7. Apple's Software Quality Crisis: When Premium Hardware Meets Subpar Software (85 points | 92 comments)
8. Why Can’t We Screenshot Frames From DRM-Protected Video on Apple Devices? (37 points | 16 comments)
9. Making Flow – Interview with director Gints Zilbalodis — (16 points | 1 comment)
10. Some things that make Rust lifetimes hard to learn (26 points | 17 comments)
11. The Fibrovisor: Turning a dollar store fibre optic wand into a low resolution display (24 points | no comments)
12. You Need Much Less Memory than Time (13 points | 4 comments)
13. Falsehoods programmers believe about languages (3 points | no comments)
14. How fast can you open 1000 files? (24 points | 13 comments)
15. Thaiger Sprint 2025: Starring H2O, the HTTP server (& dropping Nginx) (1 points | no comments)
16. smallpond: A lightweight data processing framework built on DuckDB and 3FS (6 points | no comments)
17. The power of interning: making a time series database 2000x smaller in Rust (16 points | 1 comment)
18. DuckDB goes distributed? DeepSeek’s smallpond takes on Big Data (4 points | 1 comment)
19. globstar — open-source static analysis toolkit for writing code checkers in YAML and GO (6 points | 1 comment)
20. The Botfly Test: Characterizing parasitic automated behavior in online communities (16 points | 4 comments)
21. Hacking the Xbox 360 Hypervisor Part 1: System Overview (7 points | no comments)
22. Tangled — a git collaboration platform built on atproto (54 points | 21 comments)
23. illuminant - ActivityPub server with NNTP interface (32 points | 7 comments)
24. When declarative systems break (4 points | 2 comments)
25. HATETRIS - Obsession, Friendship, and World Records (13 points | 2 comments)
